abstracts.cdata!:
The Railway Efficiency Improvement
            Project is part of a comprehensive program of technical,
            economic and financial improvements in the railway subsector
            being undertaken in Thailand.  The core activity involves a
            major technical assistance and training program
            concentrating on reducing the operating cost per traffic
            unit through more efficient operations and increasing
            revenue.  The benefits of this project should become
            apparent in about two years, and will become the foundation
            for a major reorientation of the State Railway of
            Thailand's (SRT) operating and maintenance procedures.
            To that end, the project involves a major component of (a)
            technical assistance for a management information system,
            freight and passenger marketing, equipment rationalization
            and procedures to improve the planning and operations of the
            mechanical and civil engineering departments.  In addition,
            the project provides (b) training of railway staff in the
            areas of the technical assistance already mentioned as well
            as (c) acquisition of computer hardware and software.
            Economic benefits under the project are expected from:  (a)
            improved efficiencies in railway operations; and (b)
            reduction in SRT's losses, initiating the process of
            making SRT into a viable state enterprise.
